channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Shark Tank entrepreneur: E-commerce giants are eating my sister's lunch—and destroying the American Dream
item.description: Although e-commerce platforms say they do their best to counter knockoffs, our experience proves the opposite.

item.title: Friday's biggest analyst calls: Warner Bros. Discovery to rally, Scotch tape maker upgraded
item.description: A media giant and a consumer goods maker were among the top names talked about by analysts on Friday.

item.title: Apple forced into rare apology for 'tone-deaf' iPad advert
item.description: Apple’s Tor Myhren said the Big Tech giant had "missed the mark" with the video released this week, and apologized to customers who called out the brand for its "tone-deaf" marketing.

item.title: UK economy emerges from recession with 0.6% growth in first quarter
item.description: The U.K. economy has emerged from recession as gross domestic product rose 0.6% in the first quarter, beating expectations.

item.title: Baidu exec who started furor over 24/7 work culture with videos making light of staff wellbeing and warning subordinates to toe the line has resigned
item.description: “I’m not your mother-in-law,” she said in one of the clips she posted to Douyin, China’s version of TikTok.

item.title: Novavax signs deal with Sanofi to commercialize Covid vaccine, develop combo shots
item.description: The deal will allow Novavax to lift its "going concern" warning, which it first issued in 2023 due to having "substantial doubt" about its ability to survive.

item.title: SoftBank has sold off or written down $29 billion in U.S. Vision Fund assets as Masayoshi Son tries to get his mojo back by turning to AI and chips
item.description: One project reportedly being considered by Softbank's CEO: a $100 billion chip venture to compete with Nvidia.

item.title: India's near 8% GDP growth isn't transforming into stock market returns. Here's why
item.description: This year has also been particularly unlucky for Indian stock market investors thanks to the uncertainty added by politics.

item.title: Biden administration expected to impose sweeping tariffs on China strategic sectors
item.description: The decision is the culmination of a review of so-called Section 301 tariffs first put into place under Trump starting in 2018.

item.title: The U.S. is now Germany’s biggest trading partner — taking over from China
item.description: After years of China being Germany’s main trading partner, the U.S. quietly overtook that spot in the first quarter of the year, data calculations show.
